title: Spurs continue dominance over OKC with 3rd win
content: The San Antonio Spurs defeated the Oklahoma City Thunder 117-102 on Thursday for their third win over the defending NBA champs in the past two weeks.

title: AD exits with groin injury as Mavs fall to Warriors
content: Dallas Mavericks center Anthony Davis exited the Christmas Day game at the Golden State Warriors in the second quarter with a right groin injury.

title: Lamar misses practice again; doubtful vs. Packers
content: Baltimore Ravens star quarterback Lamar Jackson is doubtful for Saturday's game at Green Bay, with backup Tyler Huntley set to start if the two-time MVP remains sidelined.

title: Sources: Soderstrom, A's agree, 7 years, $86M
content: Left fielder Tyler Soderstrom and the A's are in agreement on a seven-year, $86 million contract with a club option for an eighth season and escalators that can max out at $131 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Dak's 'pride' has him planning to play final game
content: Dak Prescott reiterated after Thursday's win that he wants to play in next week's season finale versus the Giants, citing his pride in not finishing below .500 as a team.

title: Bench, Brunson rally Knicks to comeback win
content: Jalen Brunson scored 34 points, reserve Jordan Clarkson had 25 and the Knicks came from 17 down in the fourth quarter to beat the Cavaliers 126-124 and win on Christmas Day for the third straight year.

title: Sources: Nuggets' Johnson out at least 4-6 weeks
content: Nuggets forward Cameron Johnson will be reevaluated in four to six weeks after suffering a bone bruise and hyperextended right knee, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Jaguars CB Lewis out for season with foot injury
content: Jaguars cornerback Jourdan Lewis will miss the remainder of the season because of a foot injury that will require surgery.

title: Five NBA games, three NFL games, one loaded Christmas Day slate: Everything you need to know
content: We're previewing all eight Christmas Day games across two sports with picks, predictions, storylines and more.

title: 'That's what we sign up for': Five tales -- and a few gripes -- from playing on Christmas
content: With NBA Christmas games on the horizon, stars and coaches share their stories and gripes about playing on the holiday.

title: 'Mr. Eligible': The growing fraternity of NFL sixth offensive linemen
content: NFL teams are using sixth O-linemen in more plays this season, and we're highlighting, yep -- six of them.

title: Bah humbug: An NFL holiday story, featuring festive names from around the league
content: From Jaylin Noel to Julius Chestnut, the fictional Holiday Bowl is full of holiday cheer as told by Rich Cimini.

title: Tracking the NFL playoff picture: Updated chances to clinch open spots, win division titles
content: We are following the 2025 NFL season's playoff picture. Here's how things look right now for wild-card spots, division races and even the draft order.

title: NFL Week 17 buzz: What we're hearing on Joe Burrow, the red-hot Jaguars and Pro Bowl rosters
content: Here's the latest, including intel on Burrow's future, opening QB1 spots, the Jaguars' legitimacy and Pro Bowl roster fallout.

title: NFL execs on how Tua Tagovailoa lost his edge and Mike McDaniel's support
content: What has gone wrong for Tagovailoa, what's the Dolphins' path forward and is there any interest in him?

title: NBA Power Rankings: Young risers to watch on all 30 teams
content: From ROY and MIP races, our NBA insiders break down all 30 teams' young riser in this week's Power Rankings.

title: The 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, ranked!
content: Here are the 50 best women's soccer players in the world for 2025, as ranked by an expert panel of coaches, GMs and journalists.

title: This will be the Premier League's quietest Boxing Day ever: Where did all the games go?
content: The day after Christmas is usually jam-packed with great Premier League matchups, but not this year. What gives?

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 17, featuring Travis Kelce
content: Before the NFL's Christmas Day slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Christmas Day and all of Week 17
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: A miracle child, a priceless penny and a racing legend
content: Back in 1998, long before the United States stopped producing the penny, a little girl with spina bifida gave Dale Earnhardt a gift that raises the question: What if pennies are actually worth everything?

title: Bracketology: UConn supplants Duke as fourth No. 1 seed
content: The Huskies return to the top line as Duke drops to a 2-seed after suffering its first loss of the season.

title: Power Rankings: Should UConn or Texas be No. 1?
content: Texas has the best two-way point guard in the game. UConn might have the two best players in the nation.

title: Bracketology: Louisville up, Tennessee down as host battle heats up
content: A decisive win over Tennessee put Louisville solidly inside the top 16 -- and dropped the Lady Vols to a 6-seed.

title: Why and when the WNBPA executive committee might vote to strike
content: How and when would the WNBPA executive committee vote to strike? What would that entail? What benefits would be lost?

title: World Junior Championship guide: Top contenders, key players to watch
content: The tournament starts Thursday, with the best under-20 players in hockey. Here are gold medal favorites, players set to break out.

title: The NHL's best this week: Is Craig Berube on the hot seat in Toronto?
content: As the holiday break approaches, the Maple Leafs aren't exactly excelling. Plus, key games in the week ahead.

title: A 12-player blockbuster? Cy Young signings? Ranking the biggest MLB Christmas week moves
content: Who says the baseball offseason slows down for the holidays? Let's remember some free agent signings and trades.

title: Aggrieved fan index: The 10 fan bases in 2025 that have the right to be most frustrated
content: Who has reason for jeer this holiday season? We break down which teams' fans have the most reasons to be mad.

title: Best bets, DFS plays for the Christmas Day tripleheader: Edge to the road teams
content: Betting the Christmas Day games? Here are the odds, game picks, prop plays and daily fantasy tips for all three.

title: NBA betting: Two ways to get more value betting on the Thunder this season
content: Andre Snellings looks at the creative ways to bet the NBA's best team this season and still get value.

title: What's new heading into second season of TGL
content: From signature holes to a bigger and better putting green, the TGL is ready for the start of the 2026 season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Murillo, Aké in defensive push
content: Barcelona want Nottingham Forest defender Murillo or Manchester City's Nathan Aké on loan. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Attacks on Christians contradict PM's message of harmony, visit to church: Gehlot
content: Symbolic gestures would not be enough, and strict legal action was required against those spreading hatred, says Congress leader Ashok Gehlot

title: Four arrested for pre-Christmas vandalism in Assam school
content: Miscreants who vandalised the school have been arrested. They entered the premises unlawfully, says a senior police official

title: Tightening the opium belt in Madhya Pradesh
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court’s remark that a case against an 18-year-old man, arrested for illegal opium possession, was ‘rather suspicious’, led to the suspension of six police personnel. It also brought the focus back on Malwa region’s historic opium cultivation. Mehul Malpani reports on how farmers find themselves caught between drug smuggling and crackdowns by government agencies

title: IIT-Kanpur survey to assess extent of sand mining was illegal, says T.N. govt.
content: ED had tasked the institute to assess the quantum of sand mined at 28 permitted sites during October-November 2023

title: This winter, Christmas festivities lift spirit of moribund Kashmir tourism
content: According to local hoteliers, occupancy of most hotels jumped from around 20% to around 70% on eve of Christmas

title: Circulatory system diseases remain leading cause of deaths in 2023: Report
content: Annual report on medical certification of cause of deaths showed circulatory system disease was the leading cause of death in medically certified deaths across all age groups starting from 15 years of age

title: Toy industry in the State is now worth around ₹1,000 crore
content: December witnessed two significant developments — one involving Funskool, the Chennai-headquartered toy manufacturer, and the other emerging from the temple town of Madurai. Funskool announced its foray into the electronic toys segment with the launch of a new product range, while Madurai-based Rigwheels, which began operations in 2024, unveiled its debut product — the Vande Bharat toy train

title: AIADMK forms panel to draft manifesto for 2026 Assembly poll
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami says the committee will tour Tamil Nadu to elicit opinions and views from the general public while drafting the manifesto

title: FSSAI warns food businesses against labeling herbal infusions as ‘tea’
content: Under FSSAI regulations, the term ‘tea’ can be used on packaging and labels only for beverages derived from Camellia sinensis

title: President Murmu releases Constitution of India in Santhali language
content: The President said it is a matter of pride and joy for all the Santhali people, and it will enable them to read and understand the Constitution in their own language

title: Southern districts of Tamil Nadu come alive with Christmas fete
content: Special midnight masses were organised in churches. Coastal villages came alive with festive decorations featuring themed cribs, lights, decorations, musical events, and community celebrations

title: Work on construction of High Court building begins in Amaravati
content: Designed by internationally renowned firm Norman Foster and Partners, the complex coming up in an area of 21 lakh square feet will house 52 court halls, and is targeted to be completed by the end of 2027, says MA&UD Minister Narayana

title: You have been integrated with BJP: Samik tells Suvendu not to dwell on the past
content: During an event organised by the BJP, Suvendu Adhikari took to the stage and said that other from the old and new leaders a section joined the party after being expelled from other parties or getting disillusioned with them

title: Migrant worker killed in Odisha, Trinamool says targeted for speaking in Bengali
content: This is not the first time that attacks and death of migrant workers from West Bengal in BJP-ruled states have evoked strong reactions from the Trinamool Congress leadership

title: Thirupparankundram deepam row: what Sthaneeka Bhattars testified 30 years ago
content: When a row broke out over lighting of Karthigai Deepam at the hill in Madurai, four Sthaneeka Bhattars of the Subramaniaswami  Temple testified that the lamp had been lit at the Uchipillaiyar  Temple since “time immemorial”

title: Amit Shah to inaugurate anti-terror conference on December 26
content: The conference will be attended by senior police officers from the States, and officers from Central agencies and Departments dealing with counter terrorism

title: Carrying the red flag into the next century
content: As the Communist Party of India marks a century of political engagement, its legacy invites reflection on the task to rebuild India on the foundations of equality, secularism, and justice

title: Gujarat Assembly Deputy Speaker Jethabhai Bharwad resigns
content: The BJP MLA was elected as the Deputy Speaker for the first time in September 2021 and was re-elected to the post following the Assembly elections in 2022

title: 915 Maharashtra villages back dignified life for widows
content: For centuries now, the tradition of publicly removing the ornaments considered to be the symbols of marriage for a woman has been prevalent in Maharashtra 915 villages in Nashik district have passed a resolution that they will not follow this evil tradition

title: Aravalli row: Yadav, Ramesh trade charges over mining and forest data
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh claimed that the government is imperilling the Aravallis quoting Forest Survey of India data; Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav countered it claiming that FSI has not surveyed the height of Aravalli hills

title: Railway Ministry notifies fare hike; new ticket prices come into effect on Dec. 26
content: The fare list displayed at stations will also be updated to reflect the new fares effective from December 26

title: Allahabad HC quashes forgery case against shooter Vartika Singh
content: Court finds no evidence of cheating; notes absence of inquiry into origin of alleged forged documents

title: Bus fires kill 64 nationwide since 2021; Karnataka sees three incidents
content: This excludes at least six people who were killed after a container truck rammed  the Bengaluru-bound bus, triggering a blaze that rapidly engulfed the vehicle and left passengers with little time to escape on Thursday

title: Chandrababu Naidu seeks establishment of Central Agricultural University in Andhra Pradesh
content: In a memorandum to Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, the Chief Minister also sought approvals for setting up a Coconut Park, a modern Aqua Laboratory, and a Mango Board to strengthen agricultural value chains and generate employment opportunities in the rural areas

title: Missed bus, narrow escape: Survivors describe panic, delays in services after bus caught fire
content: A survivor recounts desperate moments as he escaped out of the burning vehicle: ‘I jumped down, broke the window, and managed to pull another passenger out. Within 40 seconds, everything was burning. Nothing was visible. Thick smoke engulfed the bus, and we could not make out if people were still inside or even where to run.’

title: Neither people of Vizag nor their representatives consulted on Rushikonda buildings, says BJP MLA
content: Objecting to the Cabinet Sub-Committee’s plan to recommend the handing over of the buildings to major hotel groups, Vishnu Kumar Raju says the opinion of the people of Visakhapatnam must be taken into consideration

title: ‘Killing innocent Christians’: Trump orders US strikes on ISIS in Nigeria; signals more action
content: US President Donald Trump announced a "powerful and deadly strike" against ISIS terrorists in northwest Nigeria, citing their targeting and killing of Christians. He claimed the "Department of War" executed "perfect strikes" at his direction, vowing to prevent radical Islamic terrorism from prospering. Trump had previously warned of repercussions if the slaughter of Christians continued.

title: Fire & cold: Karnataka crash survivors recall ordeal as ambulances arrive late
content: Passengers escaped a bus fire near Hiriyur after a collision, facing a long, cold wait for medical aid. Despite quick firefighter response, ambulances were delayed by heavy traffic, leaving injured survivors to rely on locals for initial help and transport to hospitals.

title: Who is Ganesh Uike? Top Maoist from Telangana with Rs 1.1 crore bounty killed in Odisha
content: Maoist commander Ganesh Uike, also known as Paka Hanumanthu and carrying a Rs 1.1 crore bounty, was killed in a security operation in Odisha's Kandhamal district. A central committee member and Odisha in-charge, he was linked to major operations like the 2013 Jhiram Ghati ambush. His death is considered a significant milestone in eliminating Naxalism.

title: Record! 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi scripts history
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi made history by smashing 190 off 84 balls for Bihar against Arunachal Pradesh in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He became the youngest to score a List A hundred and the first men’s cricketer to hit centuries in both List A and T20 cricket before 15. His knock helped Bihar post a record 574.

title: 'Work from Home' is officially dead, says CEO of the world’s largest recruitment company
content: Major tech and finance companies, including Amazon, Google, and JPMorgan, are mandating a full return to the office for employees in 2025. This shift signals an end to the remote work era, with flexibility now becoming a perk reserved for top performers possessing specialized skills.

title: In MP, a highway learns to slow down for tigers
content: India's first wildlife-safe road corridor debuts on Bhopal-Jabalpur highway. A 12km stretch through a tiger reserve features speed-calming red markings, fencing, and 25 underpasses. This integrated approach aims to drastically reduce animal road deaths by guiding wildlife and slowing vehicles in critical tiger habitats.

title: Prayers & a message as PM Modi joins Christmas service
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended a Christmas service, emphasizing love and compassion, as the BJP intensifies its outreach to the Christian community. Party president JP Nadda also participated in regional celebrations. This engagement follows previous outreach efforts, though opposition highlights concerns over incidents targeting Christians in some areas.

title: MoEF told Survey of India to map Aravali hills by 100m rule
content: The government has directed the Survey of India to map the Aravalis using a new 100-meter height definition, sparking widespread protests. Environmentalists fear this shift to a height-based marker will significantly shrink the recognized ranges, potentially undermining conservation efforts for the predominantly low-lying Aravalis. The ministry maintains mining controls remain intact.

title: iRobot Bankruptcy: Co-founder explains reason; blames Chinese rivals, Amazon deal block
content: iRobot, famed for its Roomba vacuums, has filed for bankruptcy, with former CEO Colin Angle citing fierce competition from Chinese firms. He highlighted how these rivals leveraged China's domestic market and government support, creating an uneven playing field.  The failed Amazon acquisition further complicated iRobot's struggles, ultimately impacting the broader consumer robotics sector.

title: Labelled Bangladeshi, youth lynched in Odisha, claim kin; police cite monetary dispute
content: A 20-year-old Bengali mason, working in Odisha for the first time, was tragically beaten to death by a mob. While his family claims he was falsely accused of being Bangladeshi, police state the violence erupted from a monetary dispute. Two other migrant workers were critically injured in the attack.

title: Navi Mumbai airport takes off with 48 flights, 4k passengers
content: Navi Mumbai International Airport officially opened its doors with the arrival of IndiGo flight 6E460 from Bengaluru. The new gateway handled 48 flights and over 4,000 passengers on its first day, significantly easing Mumbai's air traffic congestion. Despite initial signage and road access challenges, the airport marks a major expansion for the region's connectivity.

title: NFL’s cryptic Stranger Things crossover post leaves fans amused and confused
content: The NFL sparked online speculation with a cryptic video featuring individuals in pink, reminiscent of Netflix's Stranger Things. This eerie, context-free post, captioned with a question about concern, leveraged internet humor and ambiguity to drive engagement. The league's subtle approach blurred marketing and pop culture, effectively reaching younger audiences by participating in broader entertainment conversations.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
content: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Gurgaon shooting: Woman refuses marriage proposal, 2 open fire at her; arrested
content: A disturbing episode occurred near a workplace in Gurgaon, where a woman was shot by a man she had previously rebuffed. The police swiftly acted, arresting two suspects, Tushar and Shubham, in Uttar Pradesh. Tushar reportedly confessed that his violent outburst stemmed from his inability to accept her refusal, marking a troubling escalation of previous unwanted advances.

title: Viral video shows Clavicular and N3on attacked as Kick ban controversy grows
content: A viral video shows Braden “Clavicular” and N3on being splashed with a red liquid by a man many online users link to a past livestream crash. Social media reactions remain divided. An Adin Ross associate confirmed the man survived. Clavicular has stayed silent, and his Kick channel status remains unclear.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 21: Ranveer Singh's film gets massive boost on Christmas
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' shows no signs of slowing down, smashing records in its third week at the box office. The festive Christmas period added a remarkable boost, with the film netting THIS amount on its 21st day. Despite facing competition from new releases, 'Dhurandhar' has raked in an impressive Rs 633 in total in India.

title: Nancy Kerrigan net worth: How the skating legend built wealth beyond ice
content: Nancy Kerrigan, a two-time Olympic medalist and former U.S. Champion, is celebrated for her resilience.  Following a shocking attack before the 1994 Olympics, she made a remarkable comeback, winning a silver medal.  Her post-competitive career includes ice shows, TV appearances, and endorsements, contributing to an estimated net worth of $10 million.

title: Kick bans streamer Braden ‘Clavicular’ after shocking Cybertruck livestream
content: Online streamer Braden “Clavicular” was reportedly banned from the streaming platform Kick after a livestream showed him allegedly running over a person with a Tesla Cybertruck. Clavicular claimed he acted in self-defense, fearing for his safety as people surrounded his vehicle. The condition of the individual and official details remain unclear.

title: Victor Wembanyama injury update: Will Spurs star play vs Thunder tonight?
content: Victor Wembanyama is fully cleared and set to play for the San Antonio Spurs on Christmas Day against the Oklahoma City Thunder. The Spurs will field their strongest lineup, while the Thunder are dealing with several key absences. This matchup carries significant weight, especially with Wembanyama's recent strong performances against Oklahoma City.

title: Helium cylinder explosion: Balloon seller killed, 4 injured near Mysuru Palace
content: On Thursday night, the celebration at Mysuru Palace was shattered by the tragic explosion of a helium cylinder, resulting in one death and injuring four others, including visiting tourists. The sound of the blast carried a kilometer away, alarming the community as emergency crews rushed to the scene.

title: UPSC ESE 2025 results: IIT grad overcomes cerebral palsy; secures AIR 112 in first attempt
content: Manvendra Singh, an IIT graduate living with cerebral palsy, achieved an All India Rank of 112 in the ESE 2025 exam on his first attempt. His journey, marked by overcoming physical and societal challenges since childhood, highlights immense willpower and determination.

title: Newspaper reading now a must for students in UP government schools
content: Uttar Pradesh schools will now make newspaper reading compulsory for students. A 10-minute slot during morning assembly will be dedicated to reading news, aiming to boost general knowledge, improve vocabulary, and foster critical thinking. This initiative seeks to reduce screen time and cultivate informed, empathetic citizens aware of local and global events.

title: New social media policy: Indian Army eases restrictions for soldiers
content: Indian Army eases social media restrictions for its soldiers, allowing limited access to platforms like Instagram for viewing and monitoring.  Skype, WhatsApp, Telegram, and Signal can be used for exchanging unclassified information with known contacts. YouTube, X, Quora, and LinkedIn also have specific, restricted uses, focusing on passive information gathering and professional networking, a significant shift from previous blanket bans.

title: Around 55km from Chandigarh, Sikh woman donates land for mosque; Hindus give money
content: In a heartwarming display of unity, a 75-year-old Sikh woman in Punjab's Jakhwali village donated land for a new mosque. Sikh and Hindu families are also contributing financially to the construction. This gesture highlights the village's long-standing tradition of interfaith harmony, where all communities support each other's religious needs.

title: Evander Kane’s partner Mara Teigen shares Christmas moments with Canucks star
content: Vancouver Canucks forward Evander Kane and his partner Mara Teigen shared heartwarming pictures of their Christmas celebrations. The couple featured their children, gifts, and a decorated tree. Teigen posted the photos on Instagram, showing their family enjoying the holiday season. Kane and Teigen have been together for over a decade and are engaged. They have three children together.

title: Colonel assault case: CBI drops murder bid charge; SIT accused of 'shielding' policemen
content: CBI has filed a chargesheet against four Punjab Police personnel, naming Inspector Ronnie Singh as the prime accused in the assault on Colonel Pushpinder Bath. Charges of attempted murder were dropped, replaced with 'causing grievous hurt' and 'wrongful restraint' following a parking dispute.

title: Vanessa Bryant tightens security amid new threat tied to Kobe Bryant’s legacy
content: Kobe Bryant and his teenage daughter, Vanessa Bryant, died in a tragic crash in 2020. Despite the tragedy, Vanessa Bryant has been able to rebuild her life along with their three daughters. Amid the mess, Kobe Bryant's wife, Vanessa Bryant, is now facing a tragic issue related to the NBA legend's legacy that he has left behind.

title: PM Modi: Freed country from tendency to link all good works with one family
content: Prime Minister Modi, inaugurating a memorial in Lucknow, criticized past governments for glorifying a single family and neglecting national heroes. He stated the BJP government is rectifying this by honoring all contributors and dismantling barriers like Article 370. The memorial celebrates Jan Sangh stalwarts, emphasizing the BJP's commitment to merit-based recognition over dynastic politics.

title: More than medicine: How a weight-loss drug helped US envoy free prisoners in Belarus
content: A casual chat about weight loss between a US envoy and Belarus's leader, Alexander Lukashenko, unexpectedly paved the way for releasing over 120 political prisoners.  The personal exchange, involving a prescription drug, helped break the ice for crucial negotiations on sanctions relief and prisoner swaps, ultimately reuniting families and easing US restrictions on key Belarusian exports.

title: No baraats, no brides, no beginnings: Inside India's ‘Hamlet of Bachelors’
content: Barwan Kalan, a remote Bihar village, is dubbed the "hamlet of bachelors" as lack of roads, water, and electricity has prevented marriages for over 50 years. Despite being near tourist spots, residents face isolation, with basic services like hospitals and schools miles away.

title: 'Decorative piece': After India slams razing of Hindu statue, Thailand offers explanation
content: Thailand defended demolishing a Vishnu statue near the Cambodian border, citing security and administration. India expressed strong disapproval, calling the act disrespectful to Hindu sentiments. Cambodia confirmed the statue was on its territory and condemned the destruction, amidst ongoing border clashes that have claimed numerous lives

title: Will Travis Kelce play tonight? Retirement rumours swirl before Broncos clash
content: The Kansas City Chiefs' tight end, Travis Kelce, has sparked retirement rumors as the team recorded a pretty average performance this season. Amid this, many fans are stressing whether the team's popular tight end, Travis Kelce, will be taking the field at the Arrowhead Stadium tonight as the Chiefs gear up to face the Denver Broncos.

title: ‘Say his name’: Laura Loomer on lynching of Hindu man in Bangladesh; attacks Islamic hatred
content: A Hindu factory worker, Dipu Chandra Das, was lynched in Bangladesh following unverified blasphemy accusations. Right-wing activist Laura Loomer highlighted the incident, warning of spreading Islamist hatred and urging international attention. The killing has reignited concerns for religious minorities in Bangladesh, with critics questioning the current leadership's response to such attacks.

title: 'Houses of 7 Hindu families burnt': Arson attacks spike in B'desh; family narrates horror
content: At least seven Hindu families in Bangladesh have had their homes burnt down in targeted attacks over the past five days amidst national turmoil.  One family narrowly escaped a fire by cutting through their walls, with police arresting five suspects and vowing to track down others. These incidents follow two recent lynchings of minority members, sparking outrage over safety concerns.

title: 'Ready to enhance trust with India': China slams explosive US report; evasive on Pak ties
content: China has strongly refuted a US Pentagon report alleging it's using eased border tensions with India to undermine US-India ties. Beijing insists its defence policy is misrepresented and aims to sow discord. China maintains its border situation with India is stable and seeks to advance a sound bilateral relationship, while dismissing US claims as biased and confrontational.

title: Frank Lampard and Christine Lampard net worth 2025: Football and TV success
content: Former Chelsea star Frank Lampard, a decorated player and manager, has achieved significant success in football. His wife, Christine Lampard, is a highly recognized and versatile TV presenter. Despite their public profiles, the couple prioritizes their children, maintaining a combined net worth estimated at £100 million through their respective careers and investments.

title: Indian truck drivers challenge California over mass licence cancellations
content: Thousands of Indian truck drivers in California are suing the state after their commercial licenses were slated for cancellation due to federal audit findings on expiry dates. Drivers, many of whom are Punjabi Sikhs, argue the state's errors are punishing them and threatening their livelihoods and families. Advocacy groups warn of increased profiling and wider economic disruption.

title: Delhi high court bars dummy school from running classes XI and XII, admitting students
content: Delhi High Court has barred Richmondd Global School from admitting new students to classes XI and XII and initiated contempt proceedings against its management for violating a previous undertaking. The court ordered the school to deposit Rs 75 lakh, collected from students enrolled only on paper, and allowed 128 students to transfer to a nearby CBSE-affiliated school.

title: Is Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Rockets? Latest Lakers injury update
content: Luka Doncic's status for the Lakers' Christmas game against the Rockets remains uncertain, listed as questionable with a lower left leg contusion. He missed the recent loss to Phoenix after sustaining the injury on December 20.  His potential return significantly impacts the game's dynamics and betting lines, with a final decision expected close to tip-off.

title: Political scorecard in 2025: Top 10 winners and losers of this year
content: 2025 saw political shifts with Nitish Kumar retaining power in Bihar and Siddaramaiah navigating a leadership tussle. While Nitin Nabin and Chirag Paswan rose, the Congress faced defeats and internal strife. Arvind Kejriwal's AAP lost Delhi, and Prashant Kishor's political venture faltered, highlighting power's dynamic nature.

title: B'desh crisis: Yunus govt accused of role in minority persecution; fanning India hate
content: Bangladesh Students League president Saddam Hussain accused the interim government and its leader Muhammad Yunus of encouraging anti-India rhetoric to appease extremist groups and cover up governance failures. He also criticised the return of BNP acting chairman Tarique Rahman, calling it a backdoor deal that could deepen political polarisation and undermine democracy. The developments come amid continued mob killings, political unrest and heightened concerns over minority safety and law and order ahead of the February 17 general elections.

title: J&K: Authorities ban all VPNs for two months in Kathua; order cites security concerns
content: Authorities in Jammu's Kathua district have suspended VPN services for two months due to security concerns, following similar actions in Rajouri and Poonch. Citing misuse for bypassing cyber restrictions and accessing prohibited content, the order aims to prevent unlawful activities and protect sensitive data. The district magistrate's directive mandates strict enforcement, with violations facing legal consequences.

title: Who is Ash Kaashh? Inside Caleb Williams’ rumoured relationship
content: Caleb Williams' impressive season with the Chicago Bears is fueling dating rumors, with model Ash Kaashh being the focus. Kaashh's appearance at a Bears game and her subtle nod to Williams' signature celebration have ignited social media speculation. While neither has confirmed the relationship, fans are connecting the dots as Williams shines on and off the field.

title: Rebellion growing in Upendra Kushwaha’s party in Bihar, two more MLAs maintain distance, 8 office-bearers resign
content: Dinara MLA Alok Kumar Singh and Madhubani MLA Madhaw Anand, along with Mr. Mahto, skip the dinner party organised by party president in Patna

title: Indian Army allows ‘passive participation’ on social media, revises long-standing ban
content: Revised guidelines permit viewing access on select platforms while retaining strict controls to safeguard operational security

title: People enjoying fruits of reforms initiated by former Prime Minister A.B. Vajpayee, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The reforms have become the central pillar of India’s development, he says, and defends development of medical colleges under PPP model

title: Ban on women using smartphones in Rajasthan withdrawn; elders say prohibition kept children in mind
content: The ban was imposed following the suggestions that women should not use smartphones, a Chaudhary community member said, adding that no one was bound to follow the decision.

title: Rajasthan considering reintroduction of educational criteria for panchayat, local body polls
content: The provision for compulsory education for candidates was introduced in the State in 2015 during the tenure of the then Chief Minister Vasundhara Raje; the Congress had strongly opposed the move

title: Proposed AHINDA convention may add to leadership tussle
content: Meet threatens to open up another front between Siddaramaiah and  Shivakumar; Jarkiholi says they need not require anyone’s certificate to hold the event

title: Govt. links intel grid to National Population Register, agencies can access details of 119 crore residents
content: The Home Ministry has been advocating the use of NATGRID by State police and Central agencies to collect intelligence and speed up investigation of criminal cases

title: Congress calls for State-level consultation on December 29 against ‘black law’ on rural employment
content: New legislation weakens the MGNREGA and threatens the livelihood of the rural poor, it says, calling upon people to expose BJP’s ‘feudal policies’

title: Ensure transparency in urea distribution, build farmers’ confidence, says official
content: Special Chief Secretary of Agriculture and Cooperation Department reviews issues concerning urea supply and the procurement of pulses such as red gram and black gram by MARKFED, among others

title: CPI(M) and Congress wrangle over photographs of Sabarimala gold theft case accused with Sonia Gandhi
content: The CPI(M) has weaponised the photographs in the wake of the civic polls, which saw the UDF riding to victory on an emotive campaign powered by provocative parodies implicating the Left Democratic Front (LDF) government in the Sabarimala gold theft

title: Govt. allows inclusion of quartzite in limestone mining lease held by Ramco in Nandyal district
content: The government has fixed the seigniorage fee at ₹160 per MT for industrial use, according to G.O. Ms. No. 261

title: RSS chief  Mohan Bhagwat stresses importance of ‘gopuja’
content: He visits the ‘Saptha Gopradakshinasala’, the facility built by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams at Alipiri

title: Unrest over NoC to Vedanta for drilling oil wells in Krishna district
content: Villagers and HRF question the G.O. permitting the company to drill wells at 20 locations of Kaza Block in Movva and Guduru mandals of the district; government has issued the NoC after taking into consideration all aspects, and if there is any violation, action will be taken as per law, asserts district Collector Balaji

title: Life comes full circle for tsunami survivor Meghana
content: From enduring tsunami, Meghana takes to freediving in the same sea, which once threatened to consume her

title: Will hold general council meeting as planned: G.K. Mani
content: He alleges that the faction led by Anbumani Ramadoss is resorting to drama and terms it as a move to divert public attention in order to hold alliance talks for the upcoming Assembly election

title: Delhi air quality improves as AQI drops to 234; deterioration likely in coming days
content: Transport emissions and pollution from neighbouring cities continued to contribute significantly to the capital's air pollution load, according to official data

title: V. Muraleedharan questions legality of Kerala Cabinet's nativity card decision
content: The former Union Minister V. Muraleedharan said the authority to determine citizenship rests with the central government

title: Chandrababu Naidu breaching bail conditions, alleges YSRCP leader
content: The Chief Minister is misusing institutional powers to close cases registered against him, alleges YSRCP leader and former AAG Ponnavolu Sudhakar Reddy, while warning of approaching the Supreme Court on the issue

title: Leverage potential of PPP model to strengthen healthcare infrastructure, says Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda
content: In a letter addressed to State Health Minister Satya Kumar, he says the Centre is offering substantial financial support under Viability Gap Funding scheme for the PPP projects, under which up to 60% of the cost is borne equally between the Union and State governments

title: ‘Neuro Justice Trilogy’ proposes function-based approach to disability assessment in accident cases
content: ‘The idea of ‘Neuro Justice’ emerged from years of treating trauma patients who survived injuries but struggled to secure fair compensation because the functional impact of brain injuries was poorly understood in legal settings’

title: Kerala Lok Bhavan's December 25 event draws flak from Labour Minister Sivankutty
content: The Minister made the remarks after Lok Bhavan observed Good Governance Day on December 25 to mark the birth anniversary of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee

title: Indian Student, 20, Shot Dead Near Toronto University, Accused On The Run
content: Shivank Avasthi was found with a gunshot wound on Tuesday, in what the police said was Toronto's 41st homicide case this year.

title: Bangladesh Unrest LIVE: Yunus Government's Response On Lynching Of Another Hindu Man
content: Bangladesh Crisis LIVE: Another Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, days after Dipu Chandra Das was lynched and his body was set ablaze, local media reported on Thursday.

title: "Merry Christmas To All": Trump Launches Deadly Strikes On ISIS In Nigeria
content: Donald Trump said US forces conducted "powerful and deadly" strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria for killing Christians in the country.

title: "Tyranny Is Booming" In US: Jimmy Kimmel Slams Trump In Christmas Message
content: Talk show host Jimmy Kimmel took aim at U.S. President Donald Trump as he warned Thursday about the rise of fascism in an address to U.K. viewers dubbed "The Alternative Christmas Message."

title: Delhi Metro Runs 1st-Ever Train As Special Service On 23rd Anniversary
content: The Delhi Metro on Thursday operated its first-ever train, TS#01, as a special service to mark the anniversary of the commencement of passenger services on the network in 2002.

title: Parents Kill 17-Year-Old Daughter Over Inter-Caste Relationship, Arrested: Cops
content: A couple was arrested on Thursday for allegedly killing their 17-year-old daughter after she refused to end her relationship with a man from a different caste.

title: VHP, Bajrang Dal Activists Arrested For Christmas Vandalism In Assam
content: Four persons associated with the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal were arrested on Thursday for vandalising decorative items used for Christmas celebrations at a school and damaging festive articles in shops in Assam's Nalbari district.

title: 1 Killed, 5 Injured After Helium Balloon Cylinder Explodes In Mysuru: Cops
content: One person was killed, and five others were injured when a helium gas cylinder, used to fill balloons, exploded in Karnataka's Mysuru on Thursday, said officials.

title: Mirwaiz Farooq Removes 'Hurriyat Chairman' Designation From Social Media
content: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq, the chief cleric and a moderate separatist voice in the Kashmir Valley, on Thursday evening removed his designation as 'Chairman All Parties Hurriyat Conference' from his verified X profile.

title: 16-Year-Old Girl Found Dead In Maharashtra Government School Hostel
content: A 16-year-old girl allegedly committed suicide at a government-run ashram' (residential) school in Murbad tehsil of the district on Thursday, police said.

title: 18-Year-Old Graphic Designer Arrested For Theft, Says He Lost Job Due To AI
content: An 18-year-old graphic designer, who claimed to have lost his job due to AI, was arrested with his NEET-aspirant woman friend on Thursday for allegedly stealing jewelry worth Rs 16 lakh.

title: Man Strangles Wife, Jumps In Front Of Train In Delhi
content: A 40-year-old woman was allegedly strangled by her husband who later jumped to his death in front of a train in east Delhi's Vivek Vihar area, police said on Thursday.

title: 2 Arrested With Country-Made Pistols In Bulletproof SUV In Delhi
content: The Delhi Police has arrested two armed men and seized a bullet-proof SUV during a routine vehicle check in outer north Delhi on Christmas eve, officials said on Thursday.

title: Resident Doctors Announce Mass Leave To Protest Shimla Doctor's Suspension
content: The Resident Doctors Association of Indira Gandhi Medical College and Hospital, Shimla, has announced a day-long mass casual leave on December 26 to protest the termination of Dr Raghav Nirula.

title: Woman, 25, Shot At In Gurugram Club For Refusing Marriage Proposal
content: A 25-year-old woman was shot at inside a club in Gurugram after she allegedly refused a marriage proposal from a man, police said on Thursday.

title: President Droupadi Murmu Releases The Constitution Of India In Santhali
content: The President of India, Droupadi Murmu, officially released the Constitution of India in the Santhali language during a ceremony held at Rashtrapati Bhavan today.

title: Census 2027 Phase-I Pre-Test Completed, April 2026 Rollout Planned
content: The discussion to be executed in further operations planned soon after the completion of the pre-test exercise of the Phase I - Houselisting and Housing Census, which was concluded earlier this month.

title: "What Was CBI Doing Before?": Unnao Rape Survivor On Kuldeep Sengar's Bail
content: The 2017 Unnao rape case victim expressed her disappointment and anger with the judgment of the Delhi High Court granting bail to the accused, former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, and raised questions over the CBI's role in the case.

title: 5 Killed After Helicopter Crashes On Tanzania's Mount Kilimanjaro
content: Five people were killed, including two Czech tourists, after a helicopter crashed on Mount Kilimanjaro, the authorities in Tanzania announced on Thursday.

title: 40 Masked Men Vandalise Christmas Decor In Chhattisgarh's Raipur
content: Unidentified persons were booked for vandalising Christmas decorations at a mall in Chhattisgarh capital Raipur, a police official said on Thursday.

title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
content: the transfer window opens in early January across the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A . but clubs have been busy planning their business for months . arsenal's summer spend was so comprehensive that they now have the best squad depth in England .

title: Will your team make the playoffs? Simulate the rest of the regular season

title: NBA Christmas Day fashion, led by LeBron James, Luka Doncic
content: this marks the 18th straight season with a five-game slate on christmas day . the festivities tipped off at noon ET when the new york Knicks host the Cleveland Cavaliers . some of the NBA's biggest names stayed in the holiday spirit with their pregame fashion .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Micah Alejado helps Hawai'i erase 21-point deficit
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . quarterback micah Alejado proved to be the best quarterback on the field Wednesday .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: Power Rankings: Kentucky, Seton Hall crack top 25
content: Kentucky dropped out of these Power Rankings back on Dec. 4 . the Wildcats lost by 35 points to Gonzaga in Nashville on tuesday . a complete roster looks very much like a top-25 team, if the second half is any indication .

title: Why believe in Tyler Shough, Malik Willis and other unlikely playoff starters?
content: a new year threatens to begin before you've processed the entirety of the one that you're still navigating . the month of December rolled out at an excruciating pace . there are a variety of pocketed countdown calendars replete with surprises like chocolates or crystals .

title: Doncic, Reaves and the hilarious bromance fueling the Lakers' wild start
content: the 8,000-sQUARE-FOOT Manhattan Beach mansion was designed with a minimalist motif . the five-bedroom home was built from tennis star Maria Sharapova . it features a premium man cave amenity that doubles as an irresistible lure for competition junkies .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Snap reactions to every Week 17 game: Cowboys win first Christmas game, Vikings handle Lions
content: the Vikings jumped all over Washington early but had to hold on after several big plays . the game began on Christmas day with an NFC East showdown between the Cowboys and Commanders . our reporters reacted to all the action, answering lingering questions coming out of each game and detailing everything you need to know for every team .

title: 🔎 Inside Penn State's 58-day coaching search
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: Bundesliga's best so far: Olise, Díaz stand out in Bayern's dominance this season
content: Harry Kane is the fastest player to reach 100 Bundesliga goal contributions . the keeper is the top-ranked player in the world-class category . he wants and deserves another season in the upcoming season . click here for all the latest bayern munich news .
